title: Quiz 2 - Data Sufficiency
instruction: Directions: Each of the questions below consists of a question and two or more statements numbered I, II, III and so on given below it. You have to decide whether the data provided in the statements are sufficient to answer the question:

quiz.text: There are five floors in a building, numbered 1 to 5 in such a way that the lowermost floor is numbered as 1 and topmost floor is numbered as 5. Five members live at different floors of the building namely, Raman, Satish, Prakash, Tarun and Umang, but not necessarily in the same order. Also, these five works in different companies namely, TCS, Wipro, Infosys, Accenture, and Cognizant. Prakash stays on Floor no 2 and works in company Accenture and Tarun stays on floor no 5. Also, the one who stays on floor no 1 is working in company TCS. Then who lives on floor no 3 and in which company does she/he work? Conditions: I. Neither Satish nor Umang works in company TCS. II. One who lives on floor 3 works in company Infosys. III. Umang does not work in company Infosys.
options: Condition I and II together are sufficient
Condition II and III together sae suffucient
Either I & III are sufficient is sufficient
Either II or III are sufficient
All 3 conditions together are sufficient

quiz.text: There are six bottles and numbers from 1 to 6 are written on them. These bottles contain different liquids of different colours – Black, Pink, Violet, Grey, Indigo and Brown, which have six different tastes - Salty, Sweet, Sour, Bitter, Tasteless, and Spicy but not necessarily in the same order. Bottle no 4 contains a pink liquid which is sour in taste. Brown liquid is kept in bottle no 5 and the one which is Violet in colour, is spicy in taste. Also bottle 1 contains a tasteless liquid. If Shruti doesn’t like bitter taste which colour liquid she should not drink and in which, is it kept. Conditions: I. Black liquid is kept in bottle no. 1. Bottle no 2 contains a liquid of grey colour which tastes salty. The sweet liquid is kept in a bottle which contains a number equals to Addition of the no of bottles that contain Black and Pink liquids. II. Bottle no 6 contains a Violet liquid. Bottle no 2 contains a grey liquid. Brown liquid tastes sweet while Black does not have any taste. Also, Indigo is kept in bottle no 3.
options: Condition I alone is sufficient while condition II alone is not
Condition II alone is sufficient while condition I alone is not
Either I or II alone is sufficient
Both I and II together are sufficient
Both I and II together are not sufficient

quiz.text: What is the birth date of Shalini’s mother? Statement I: Shalini’s father remembers that his wife’s birthday is after 20th and before 23rd March. Statement II: Shalini’s brother remembers that his mother’s birthday was after 21st but before 25th March.
options: Statement 1 alone is sufficient while statement II alone is not sufficient
Statement 2 alone is sufficient while statement I alone is not sufficient
Either 1 or 2 alone is sufficient
Both 1 and 2 together are sufficient
Both 1 and 2 together are not sufficient.

quiz.text: Who is Eldest among A, B, C, D, E, and F? Statement I: D is Elder than A and C. D is younger than B. E is Elder than only F. Statement II: E is Elder than C but younger than A. F is Elder than only D. A is not the Eldest.
options: Statement I alone is sufficient while statement II alone is not sufficient
Statement II alone is sufficient while statement I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II alone is sufficient
Both I and II together are sufficient
Both I and II together are not sufficient

quiz.text: There are only five members in a family. Only married couples have children. How many children does Amit has, if Binod has no sibling? Statement I: Ekta is the only daughter of Amit. Binod, who is the only brother-in-law of Chetan, is married to daughter of Diksha, who is married to Amit. Statement II: Amit, who is married to the mother of Chetan, has only one son-in-law Binod. Ekta is the only daughter of Diksha and Diksha is also the mother of Chetan.
options: Statement I alone is sufficient while statement II alone is not sufficient
Statement II alone is sufficient while statement I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II alone is sufficient
Both I and II together are sufficient
Both I and II together are not sufficient

quiz.text: What is the code for “Working” in a certain language? Statement I: In a certain language “My laptop is not working” is coded as “bn de tf sj lk” and “Laptop consists camera and speakers” is coded as “gh rn wl di lk” Statement II: In a certain language “Working knowledge of Computer” is coded as “pq wm zi bn” and “working smart is best” is coded as “oa tf  bn xc al”.
options: Statement I alone is sufficient while statement II alone is not sufficient
Statement II alone is sufficient while statement I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II alone is sufficient
Both I and II together are sufficient
Both I and II together are not sufficient

quiz.text: Five friends are studying in MBA college namely Anjali, Binoty, Charu, Deepa, and Esha. All of them are sitting in a row facing towards north. Who is sitting three places to the right of Deepa? Statement I: Anjali is two places to the right of Binoty. Binoty is not adjacent to Charu or Esha. The number of persons to the left of Esha is the same as the number of persons to the right of Binoty. Statement II: Esha is sitting to the right of Charu and none of them is adjacent to Deepa, who is not at the extreme end of the row. The number of persons to the left of Esha is the same as the number of persons to the right of Binoty.
options: Statement I alone is sufficient while statement II alone is not sufficient
Statement II alone is sufficient while statement I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II alone is sufficient
Both I and II together are sufficient
Both I and II together are not sufficient

quiz.text: In which year was Rajan born ? Statement I: Rajan at present is 25 years younger to his mother. Statement II: Rajan's brother, who was born in 1964, is 35 years younger to his mother
options: Statement I alone is sufficient while statement II alone is not sufficient
Statement II alone is sufficient while statement I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II alone is sufficient
Both I and II together are sufficient
Both I and II together are not sufficient

quiz.text: How many children does A have ? Statement I: E is the only daughter of L who is wife of A. Statement II: C and N are brothers of A.
options: Statement I alone is sufficient while statement II alone is not sufficient
Statement II alone is sufficient while statement I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II alone is sufficient
Both I and II together are sufficient
Both I and II together are not sufficient

quiz.text: What is Vinay's rank from the top in the class of 50 students?   Statement I : Ginni is 4 ranks below Vinay and is thirty second from the the bottom.  Statement II : Binod is three ranks above Vinay and thirty seventh from the bottom.
options: Statement I alone is sufficient while statement II alone is not sufficient
Statement II alone is sufficient while statement I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II alone is sufficient
Both I and II together are sufficient
Both I and II together are not sufficient

quiz.text: Six persons – I, J, K, L, M, and N are sitting in a circular table facing to the centre and each belongs to different cities – Pune, Nizammudin, Raipur, Saharanpur, Tonk and Udaipur then, who sits immediate right of the one who belongs to Raipur?   I: J sits second to the left of one who belongs to Pune, who sits second to the left of I. One who belongs to Nizamuddin is facing J, who is an immediate neighbor of one who belongs to Saharanpur.  II: N belongs to Tonk and sits second to the right of L, who sits third to the left of M. One who belongs to Udaipur sits immediate right of L.
options: Statement I alone is sufficient while statement II alone is not sufficient
Statement II alone is sufficient while statement I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II alone is sufficient
Both I and II together are sufficient
Both I and II together are not sufficient

quiz.text: There are four different animals in a jungle - Lion, Tiger, Cheetah and Monkeys. They sit with different trees namely - Neem, Mango, Palm and Banyan but not necessarily in the same order. Lion sits with Neem tree and Monkeys sits neither with Banyan tree nor with Mango tree. Who is sitting with Banyan tree?   I.  Tiger does not sit with Banyan tree. II. Cheetah neither sit with palm nor on Mango.
options: Statement I alone is sufficient while statement II alone is not sufficient
Statement II alone is sufficient while statement I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II alone is sufficient
Both I and II together are sufficient
Both I and II together are not sufficient

quiz.text: Seven persons – Parnika, Rupali, Anjali, Sheetal, Dipender, Bablu and Minakshi are going to watch movie on Friday, Saturday and Sunday. At least two persons are going to watch movie on same day. No person is going to watch 2 movies.   On which day Bablu is going to watch the movie?   I. Parnika and Dipender going to watch movie on same day. Bablu is going to watch movie with 2 other persons. Minakshi and Rupali are going to watch movie on different days. Sheetal is to going to watch movie on Saturday. Sheetal and Dipender are going to watch movie on different days. Dipender is going to watch movie before Minakshi who going to watch movie with Anjali. II. Parnika is going to watch movie before Bablu. Parnika isn't going to watch movie on Saturday. Anjali is going to watch movie after Sheetal. Bablu and Anjali are going to watch movie on same day. Neither Bablu nor Sheetal is going to watch movie with Dipender. Minakshi is going to watch movie with Anjali.
options: Statement I alone is sufficient while statement II alone is not sufficient
Statement II alone is sufficient while statement I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II alone is sufficient
Both I and II together are sufficient
Both I and II together are not sufficient

quiz.text: Eight persons – Hardeep, Jatin, Kamal, Mandeep, Nilesh, Palak, Anjali and Chetna are sitting around a circle at an equal distance from each other such that some of them are facing towards the centre and some are facing away from the centre. Not more than two people facing same direction are sitting together. Is the person who is sitting on the immediate right of Jatin facing away from the centre?   Statement I: Jatin is second to right of Mandeep. Kamal is sitting between Anjali and Palak. Kamal is second to right of Jatin. Nilesh and Chetna are not immediate neighbours. Statement II: Kamal faces away from the centre. Anjali is sitting immediate right of Kamal. Mandeep and Anjali are facing same direction.
options: Statement I alone is sufficient while statement II alone is not sufficient
Statement II alone is sufficient while statement I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II alone is sufficient
Both I and II together are sufficient
Both I and II together are not sufficient

quiz.text: Which direction is Devanshu facing? Statement I: If Rakesh who is currently facing North-East, turns 90° clockwise, he would face the same direction as Devanshu. Statement II: If Vineet who is currently facing North-West, turns 135° anticlockwise, he would face the direction 45° clockwise to the direction Devanshu is facing.
options: Statement I alone is sufficient while statement II alone is not sufficient
Statement II alone is sufficient while statement I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II alone is sufficient
Both I and II together are sufficient
Both I and II together are not sufficient

quiz.text:
How is the word ‘New’ coded?

 

Statement I : ‘Season change by nature’ is coded as ‘5 2 9 13’ and ‘Change is law nature’ is coded as ‘5 13 8 17’.

 

Statement II : ‘New season came today’ is coded as ’20 14 9 11’ and ‘Today change came tomorrow’ is coded as ’12 20 11 23’
options: Statement I alone is sufficient while statement II alone is not sufficient
Statement II alone is sufficient while statement I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II alone is sufficient
Both I and II together are sufficient
Both I and II together are not sufficient

quiz.text:
P, Q, R, S, and T stand in a row for a photograph. Who is standing 4th from the left?

 

Statement I : T is the person standing in the middle.

 

Statement II : P and Q are neighbors of T.
options: Statement I alone is sufficient while statement II alone is not sufficient
Statement II alone is sufficient while statement I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II alone is sufficient
Both I and II together are sufficient
Both I and II together are not sufficient

quiz.text: Six cars from A1 to A6 participated in a race. Which car stood at first position?   Statement I: A1 finished the race before two cars only. A3 was not the last one to finish the race. A4 finished the race just before A5.   Statement II: No other car finished the race after A6, which finished the race just after A3. A2 finished the race before A3.
options: Statement I alone is sufficient while statement II alone is not sufficient
Statement II alone is sufficient while statement I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II alone is sufficient
Both I and II together are sufficient
Both I and II together are not sufficient

quiz.text: City V is in which direction from City Q?   Statement I: City V is in the north of City S, who is in the west of City R. City R, P and Q form a straight line. City Q is towards the north of City R.   Statement II: City Q is in north of City P, which is in the west of City W. City V is towards the south of City U, which is in the east of city W.
options: Statement I alone is sufficient while statement II alone is not sufficient
Statement II alone is sufficient while statement I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II alone is sufficient
Both I and II together are sufficient
Both I and II together are not sufficient

quiz.text: Six batsmen are doing net practice on six days of a week starting from Monday to Saturday. Only one player practises on one day. Jadeja practises on which day?   Statement I: Shikhar practises just before Jadeja, who is not the last one to practice. Rishabh Pant practises on the first day of the week immediately followed by Shreyas. Statement II: Rishabh Pant and Shikhar practise at a gap of one day such that Rishabh Pant practises on Monday. Jadeja practises just before Virat.
options: Statement I alone is sufficient while statement II alone is not sufficient
Statement II alone is sufficient while statement I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II alone is sufficient
Both I and II together are sufficient
Both I and II together are not sufficient

quiz.text: How many students are standing in a row if all are facing north? Statement I: Two students are standing between A and B. C is the immediate neighbour of A. D is standing at extreme end of the line. D is standing third to the left of E. Statement II: E is standing at third position from left end of the row. F is standing second to the right of E. F and G are immediate neighbours. Four people are standing between G and A and A is standing at extreme end and to the left of E. Statement III: F is standing immediate left of G. There is one student standing between E and F. four people are standing to the right of E.
options: Either statement I and II or II & III together are sufficient
Statement II and III together sae sufficient
Either I & III or II & III are sufficient is sufficient
Either II or III are sufficient
All 3 statements together are sufficient

quiz.text: Five persons – Mandeep, Kamal, Raman, Satish, and Tushar, each has a different weight. Who among these persons is the heaviest?   Statement I: Only two persons are heavier than Kamal who is heavier than Tushar and Satish. Statement II: Raman, who is not the lightest, is heavier than Kamal and Satish, but not Mandeep.
options: Statement I alone is sufficient while statement II alone is not sufficient
Statement II alone is sufficient while statement I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II alone is sufficient
Both I and II together are sufficient
Both I and II together are not sufficient

quiz.text: Seven persons – Advit, Kuldeep, Jogesh, Lokesh, Abhay, Mukesh and Nitish are standing in a queue. Each of them got a different rank in the class from 1 to 7. Who is standing in the middle of the queue?   Statement I: Advit is first in the class, and he is standing two places ahead of Lokesh. Lokesh is not the last person in the queue. Statement II: Mukesh and Nitish are standing adjacent to each other, and their ranks are also numerically adjacent to each other. Statement III: Kuldeep who got 3rd rank in the class is standing behind only Abhay.
options: Either statement I and II or II & III together are sufficient
Statement II and III together sae sufficient
Either I & III or II & III are sufficient is sufficient
Either II or III are sufficient
All 3 statements together are sufficient

quiz.text: In which month is Monika’s birthday? Statement I: Shalini remembers that Monika’s birthday was 4 months ago. Statement II: Rajat remembers that after 2 months from now, Monika’s birthday will be 6 months back.
options: Statement I alone is sufficient while statement II alone is not sufficient
Statement II alone is sufficient while statement I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II alone is sufficient
Both I and II together are sufficient
Both I and II together are not sufficient

quiz.text: Are some baskets gases?  Statement I: All gases are baskets. Statement II: Only gases are buckets. Some Baskets are buckets.
options: Statement I alone is sufficient while statement II alone is not sufficient
Statement II alone is sufficient while statement I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II alone is sufficient
Both I and II together are sufficient
Both I and II together are not sufficient
